text: 1. Satyakâma, the son of G abâlâ, addressed his mother and said: 'I wish to become a Brahma k ârin (religious student), mother. Of what family am I?'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. She said to him: 'I do not know, my child, of what family thou art. In my youth when I had to move about much as a servant (waiting on the guests in my father's house), I conceived thee. I do not know of what family thou art. I am G abâlâ by name, thou art Satyakâma (Philalethes). Say that thou art Satyakâma G âbâlâ.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. He going to Gautama Hâridrumata said to him, 'I wish to become a Brahma k ârin with you, Sir. May I come to you, Sir?'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. He said to him: 'Of what family are you, my friend?' He replied: 'I do not know, Sir, of what family I am. I asked my mother, and she answered: "In my youth when I had to move about much as a servant, I conceived thee. I do not know of what family thou art. I am G abâlâ by name, thou art Satyakâma," I am therefore Satyakâma G âbâlâ, Sir.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Khândogya Upanishad... | Sacred Texts Archive

text: 5. He said to him: 'No one but a true Brâhma n a would thus speak out. Go and fetch fuel, friend, I shall initiate you. You have not swerved from the truth.'

text: Having initiated him, he chose four hundred lean and weak cows, and said: 'Tend these, friend.'
